Author: jl777c#5810
Content: first version of nspv html wallet is released. it doesnt use any javascript at all and it all static html, that is dynamically generated inside the C program

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
git clone https://github.com/jl777/libnspv
cd libnspv
./autogen.sh
./configure
make
./nspv 
now browse http://127.0.0.1:7771

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content:
Just for anyone that does not know what the big plan is, here is a break down from a outsider looking in. DEX is going to be very important soon, so will privacy coins. But the problem with DEXs have been they have been hard to use and low liquidity. Hard to use can be fixed by GUIs such as hyperDEX/atomicDEX/Chainmakers so liquidity is the biggest issue. For the liquidity problem, kmd team and my dev are designing the market maker backend. With this, once hooked up to hyperDEX, any grandma can generate API keys for their fav exchange, have some coins in the hyperDEX wallet and be able to set a profit % above CEX prices. Let's say i want 5% profit. When someone buys on the DEX, the CEX will autobuy/sell. Now who does not like free money? But my pal seeing that i am making free money, starts to use this too but to make more money instead of setting 5% he does 4.9% to undercut me. I see what he is doing so i change to 4.8%. Now we have a race to the bottom.

This arb bot will bring in all the liquidity we need, this then brings in users then in brings people just setting limit orders directly without the bot

Now there will be a % at which some think is too small to make a profit from but others will still take it. The market will self balance with people leaving and people coming.
So now we have solved the liquidity issue. Now CEX will want to hook into OUR liquidity as we will have a GLOBAL orderbook.
We will become the center of the crypto space, interconnecting all the exchanges and all the coin communities

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: There will be some game theory in play. Just like BTC miners, when the diff goes up, some stop mining as they are making a loss, once prices go up they start mining again. The liquidity bot will be the same. At 5% every man and their dog will be doing it but with competition it might go all the way to 1.5% above CEX, then most people think it is not worth it. But then since the liquidity is lower people are willing to pay 2% or 3% then people get back in. So the market will have a balance of liquidity providers and the lowest % profit they will take to provide that service.

Author: shrk#2280
Content: Two noob questions then. Is it open source? What prevents binance or any other exchange from doing the same thing, they already have their own user base.

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Yes it is open source, nothing stops them from taking it

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: But how would it benefit them? They are still "stuck" doing KYC and cant list most projects

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: This is the beauty of decentralization

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Now the goal here is not to beat/takeout Binance, we want to give an alternative to the CEXs and by providing a way for people to profit being market makers / arbing, we are essentially creating a giant global orderbook

Author: hyperDEX#6586
Content: Binance could run a market maker bot and make 2% on all trades üòõ
